intro: Orbexilum pedunculatum var. eglandulosum, commonly known as the glandular orbexilum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its distinctive, orb-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland habitats, often in dry or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are simple and ovate, while the flowers are showy and often pink or red in color. This variant is distinguished by the presence of glandular structures on its stems and leaves, which contribute to its unique botanical profile.
